GameModel

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameModel.Character
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Mob, Player

    public abstract class Character
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Character is an abstract class which is used to represent any player or computer controlled characters that can be found within the MUD.
    Author:
    Matthew Latura
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNeighbor(Character c)
      Adds a Character to this Character's map of neighbors and sets the starting distance at 2
      void attack()
      sets this Character's readyToAttack field to false and then waits for an amount of time equal to his attack delay in seconds before setting readyToAttack to true

      Clears this Character's map of neighbors

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage(int damage)
        Will subtract the passed integer from the player's current health. If Character's health cannot fall below zero and cannot go above it's maximum health.
        Parameters:
        damage - - the integer value to subtract from current health

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Returns whether or not the Character is dead
        Returns:
        if the Character's health equals 0

        Returns:
        the inventory of the Character as an ArrayList of Items

      • moveRoom

        public void moveRoom(Direction direction)
        Changes the players location to the Point one unit in the passed Direction. This method will not check for exits or boundaries, these checks should be done before calling the method
        Parameters:
        direction - - the direction to move the player's location in

      • giveItem

        public void giveItem(Item i)
        Adds the passed Item to the Character's inventory
        Parameters:
        i - - Item to be given to the Character

        Parameters:

        Returns:

              int unitsFurther)

      • distanceFrom

        public int distanceFrom(Character c)
        Returns the distance between this Character and the one passed
        Parameters:
        c - - The character to check the distance from
        Returns:
        - The distance between the two Characters, returns 10 if the passed Character was not on this Character's list of neighbors
